alert.note: Alert for Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Canyon Ferry Area; Cascade County below 5000ft; Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains; Fergus County below 4500ft; Gates of the Mountains; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Meagher County Valleys; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 8:39PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Showers with gusty winds will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark, southeastern Pondera, Broadwater, Meagher, Judith Basin, western Fergus, northeastern Jefferson, eastern Teton, southwestern Hill, northern Gallatin, Chouteau and Cascade Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 835 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers with gusty winds along a line extending from Fort Benton to 29 miles south of Belt to 16 miles east of East Helena. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Observed. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Townsend, Fort Benton, White Sulphur Springs, Cascade, Big Sandy, Stanford, Belt, Geraldine, Denton, Hobson, Moore, Highwood, Black Eagle, Toston, Geyser, The Knees, Carter, Neihart and Fort Logan On The Smith River. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A few lightning strikes may occur with this activity. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
